vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == admin, "only admin may initialize the market");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(accrualBlockNumber == 0 && borrowIndex == 0, "market may only be initialized once");
vulnerability_findings.message: Using multiple require statements is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == admin, "only admin may initialize the market");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: compound-borrowfresh-reentrancy
vulnerability_findings.message: Function borrowFresh() in Compound performs state update after doTransferOut()

vulnerability_findings.name: erc20-interface
vulnerability_findings.message:
EIP20NonStandardInterface (CEtherCertora.sol#1271-1333) has incorrect ERC20 function interface(s):
	-transfer (CEtherCertora.sol#1297)
	-transferFrom (CEtherCertora.sol#1311)

vulnerability_findings.name: incorrect-equality
vulnerability_findings.message:
CEther.getCashPrior (CEtherCertora.sol#2743-2749) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- require(bool)(err == MathError.NO_ERROR)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in CTokenDeprecated._addReservesInternal (CEtherCertora.sol#2415-2427):
	External calls:
	- error = accrueInterest() (CEtherCertora.sol#2416-2417)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- totalReserves (CEtherCertora.sol#2423-2424)

	- totalReserves (CEtherCertora.sol#2482-2483)

	- Exponential.fraction (function @ CEtherCertora.sol#1146-1148)
